text: Indian Slough is a slough, tributary to the Old River, an old channel of the San Joaquin River. Its mouth is at an elevation of 7 feet / 2 meters, at its confluence with the Old River. Its source is at its confluence with Kellogg Creek at an elevation of 7 feet / 2 meters at the location . == References == Category:Rivers of California Category:Sacramento–San Joaquin River Delta Category:Tributaries of the San Joaquin River Category:Rivers of Contra Costa County, California
title: Indian Slough (Old River tributary)
